body.p: Transport and communications - regjeringen.no
Transport and communications
It is the Ministry of Transport and Communications that has overriding responsibility for issues relating to transport, postal services and telecommunications.
On this page you will find general information and documents relating to transport and communications. You can explore this topic in more detail by using the menu on the right.
Subscribe to e-mail alert
Subscribe to RSS feed
Air services negotiations with South Korea
[News story, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 20.06.2014]
Norway, together with Denmark and Sweden, will hold air services negotiations with South Korea 2-3 September 2014.
Air services negotiations with Pakistan
[News story, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 14.01.2014]
Norway, together with Denmark and Sweden, will hold air services negotiations with Pakistan 30-31 January 2014.
The fourth NEFAB Council meeting held in Oslo
[Press release, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 04.12.2013]

The fourth meeting of the NEFAB Council since the entry into force of the NEFAB State Level Agreement took place in Oslo on 27 November 2013. The Council addressed important issues regarding the further development of the NEFAB cooperation in the years to come, in particular issues related to the European performance scheme for air navigation services.
Extended deadline for invitation to tender for the Værøy-Bodø helicopter route
[Press release, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 08.11.2013]

“No offers were received within deadline on the Værøy-Bodø helicopter route. We are therefore extending the deadline to 10 December,” says the Minister of Transport and Communications, Ketil Solvik-Olsen.
Invtation to tender - regional air services (helicopter) Værøy–Bodø
Scheduled regional air services (helicopter) Værøy–Bodø v.v.
[Call for tender, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 05.09.2013]

The Norwegian Ministry of Transport and Communications invites to an open tender procedure for regional scheduled air services on the helicopter route Værøy – Bodø v.v during the period 1 August 2014 to 31 July 2019.
Invitation to tender: Scheduled regional air services Røros–Oslo v.v. from 1 December 2012
[Call for tender, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 14.06.2012]
The Norwegian Ministry of Transport and Communications invites to an open tender procedure for regional scheduled air services on the route Røros-Oslo v.v. from 1December 2012 to 31 March 2016.
Final report - new top level domains of national importance
[Report, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 11.03.2011]
On behalf of the Norwegian Ministry of Transport and Communications, a working group has considered the need for introducing additional top level domains on the Internet.
White papers
[Article, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 01.10.2009]
Invitation to participate in auction for allocation of licence for use of third-generation (3G) mobile communications system in Norway
Deadline: Wednesday, 12th December 2007 at 16:00 p.m. local time
[Article, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 14.11.2007]

With reference to Storting White Paper No. 32 (2001-2002) and Storting White Paper No. 18 (2002-2003) and pursuant to Sections 6-2 to 6-4 of the Act of 4 July 2003 No. 83 relating to electronic communication (Electronic Communications Act), interested parties are hereby invited to participate in the auction of the licence for use of third-generation (3G) public mobile communications system in Norway. Below follows a description of the auction process / rules for selecting a new licence holder for use of 3G.
Invitation to tender: Scheduled air services in Norway - 1 January 2008 – 31 March 2009
Andenes – Bodø v.v. and Andenes – Tromsø v.v.
[Call for tender, Ministry of Transport and Communications, 20.09.2007]

The Ministry of Transport and Communications invites tenders to an open tender procedure for regional scheduled air services on the routes Andenes – Bodø v.v. and Andenes – Tromsø v.v. during the period 1 January 2008 to 31 March 2009. The deadline for submitting tenders is 22 October 2007.
